_meta.description: Representative sample of Strong's Greek definitions (G0001-G5624)

G0001.def: Alpha, the first letter of the Greek alphabet; figuratively, the beginning

G0004.derivation: from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and G922 (βάρος)

G0007.def: Abijah, the name of two Israelites

G0025.def: to love (in a social or moral sense)

G0026.def: love, i.e. affection or benevolence; specially (plural) a love-feast

G0032.def: a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor

G0037.def: to make holy, i.e. (ceremonially) purify or consecrate; (mentally) to venerate

G0040.def: sacred (physically, pure, morally blameless or religious, ceremonially, consecrated)

G0080.def: a brother (literally or figuratively) near or remote
G0080.derivation: from G1 (Α) (as a connective particle) and δελφύς (the womb)

G0138.def: probably akin to G142 (αἴρω); to take for oneself, i.e. to prefer

G0165.def: properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity (also past); by implication, the world; specially (Jewish) a Messianic period (present or future)

G0227.derivation: from G1 (Α) (as a negative particle) and λήθω (to forget)

G0281.def: properly, firm, i.e. (figuratively) trustworthy; adverbially, surely (often as interjection, so be it)

G0652.def: a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ ('apostle')

G0746.def: (properly abstract) a commencement, or (concretely) chief (in various applications of order, time, place, or rank)

G0932.def: properly, royalty, i.e. (abstractly) rule, or (concretely) a realm

G0935.derivation: probably from G939 (βάσις) (through the notion of a foundation of power)

G1096.def: to cause to be ('gen'-erate), i.e. (reflexively) to become (come into being)
G1096.derivation: a prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb

G1135.derivation: probably from the base of G1096 (γίνομαι)

G1342.def: equitable (in character or act); by implication, innocent, holy (absolutely or relatively)

G1343.def: equity (of character or act); specially (Christian) justification

G1391.def: glory (as very apparent), in a wide application (literal or figurative, objective or subjective)

G1411.def: force (literally or figuratively); specially, miraculous power (usually by implication, a miracle itself)

G1577.def: a calling out, i.e. (concretely) a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation (Jewish synagogue, or Christian community of members on earth or saints in heaven or both)
G1577.derivation: from a compound of G1537 (ἐκ) and a derivative of G2564 (καλέω)

G1680.derivation: from a primary ἔλπω (to anticipate, usually with pleasure)

G1722.derivation: a primary preposition denoting (fixed) position (in place, time or state)

G2041.def: toil (as an effort or occupation); by implication, an act
G2041.derivation: from a primary (but obsolete) ἔργω (to work)

G2098.def: a good message, i.e. the gospel

G2316.def: a deity, especially (with G3588 (ὁ)) the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate

G2424.def: Jesus (i.e. Jehoshua), the name of our Lord and two (three) other Israelites

G2532.def: and, also, even, so then, too, etc.
G2532.derivation: apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force

G2564.def: to 'call' (properly, aloud, but used in a variety of applications, directly or otherwise)
G2564.derivation: akin to the base of G2753 (κελεύω)

G2588.def: the heart, i.e. (figuratively) the thoughts or feelings (mind); also (by analogy) the middle
G2588.derivation: prolonged from a primary κάρ (Latin cor, 'heart')

G2889.def: orderly arrangement, i.e. decoration; by implication, the world (in a wide or narrow sense, including its inhabitants, literally or figuratively (morally))
G2889.derivation: probably from the base of G2865 (κομίζω)

G2962.def: supreme in authority, i.e. (as noun) controller; by implication, Master (as a respectful title)

G3056.def: something said (including the thought); by implication, a topic (subject of discourse), also reasoning (the mental faculty) or motive

G3361.def: (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas G3756 (οὐ) expects an affirmative one)) whether
G3361.derivation: a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas G3756 (οὐ) expresses an absolute denial)

G3551.def: law (through the idea of prescriptive usage), genitive case (regulation), specially, (of Moses (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively (a principle)
G3551.derivation: from a primary νέμω (to parcel out, especially food or grazing to animals)

G3588.def: the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom)
G3588.derivation: including the feminine ἡ, and the neuter τό in all their inflections

G3686.derivation: from a presumed derivative of the base of G1097 (γινώσκω) (compare G3685 (ὀνίνημι))

G3756.def: the absolute negative (compare G3361 (μή)) adverb; no or not

G3772.def: the sky; by extension, heaven (as the abode of God); by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel (Christianity)
G3772.derivation: perhaps from the same as G3735 (ὄρος) (through the idea of elevation)

G3778.def: the he (she or it), i.e. this or that (often with article repeated)
G3778.derivation: including nominative masculine plural, nominative feminine singular, and nominative feminine plural

G4012.def: properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time

G4100.def: to have faith (in, upon, or with respect to, a person or thing), i.e. credit; by implication, to entrust (especially one's spiritual well-being to Christ)

G4102.def: persuasion, i.e. credence; moral conviction (of religious truth, or the truthfulness of God or a religious teacher), especially reliance upon Christ for salvation; abstractly, constancy in such profession

G4151.def: a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christ's spirit, the Holy Spirit

G4190.def: hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from G2556 (κακός), which refers rather to essential character, as well as from G4550 (σαπρός), which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt

G4396.def: a foreteller ('prophet'); by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet
G4396.derivation: from a compound of G4253 (πρό) and G5346 (φημί)

G4561.def: flesh (as stripped of the skin), i.e. (strictly) the meat of an animal (as food), or (by extension) the body (as opposed to the soul (or spirit), or as the symbol of what is external, or as the means of kindred), or (by implication) human nature (with its frailties (physically or morally) and passions), or (specially), a human being (as such)
G4561.derivation: probably from the base of G4563 (σαρόω)

G4624.def: to entrap, i.e. trip up (figuratively, stumble (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure)

G4716.def: a stake or post (as set upright), i.e. (specially), a pole or cross (as an instrument of capital punishment); figuratively, exposure to death, i.e. self-denial; by implication, the atonement of Christ

G4982.def: to save, i.e. deliver or protect (literally or figuratively)
G4982.derivation: from a primary σῶς (contraction for obsolete σάος, 'safe')

G5056.def: properly, the point aimed at as a limit, i.e. (by implication) the conclusion of an act or state (termination (literally, figuratively or indefinitely), result (immediate, ultimate or prophetic), purpose); specially, an impost or levy (as paid)
G5056.derivation: from a primary τέλλω (to set out for a definite point or goal)

G5087.def: to place (in the widest application, literally and figuratively; properly, in a passive or horizontal posture, and thus different from G2476 (ἵστημι), which properly denotes an upright and active position, while G2749 (κεῖμαι) is properly reflexive and utterly prostrate)
G5087.derivation: a prolonged form of a primary θέω (which is used only as alternate in certain tenses)

G5207.def: a 'son' (sometimes of animals), used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship

G5228.def: 'over', i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than

G5485.def: graciousness (as gratifying), of manner or act (abstract or concrete; literal, figurative or spiritual; especially the divine influence upon the heart, and its reflection in the life; including gratitude)

G5547.def: anointed, i.e. the Messiah, an epithet of Jesus

G5590.def: breath, i.e. (by implication) spirit, abstractly or concretely (the animal sentient principle only; thus distinguished on the one hand from G4151 (πνεῦμα), which is the rational and immortal soul; and on the other from G2222 (ζωή), which is mere vitality, even of plants: these terms thus exactly correspond respectively to the Hebrew H5315 (נֶפֶשׁ), H7307 (רוּחַ) and H2416 (חַי))

G0611.def: to conclude for oneself, i.e. (by implication) to respond; by Hebraism (compare H6030 (עָנָה)) to begin to speak (where an address is expected)

G0649.def: set apart, i.e. (by implication) to send out (properly, on a mission) literally or figuratively

G1097.def: to 'know' (absolutely) in a great variety of applications and with many implications (as follow, with others not thus clearly expressed)
G1097.derivation: a prolonged form of a primary verb

G1325.def: to give (used in a very wide application, properly, or by implication, literally or figuratively; greatly modified by the connection)
G1325.derivation: a prolonged form of a primary verb (which is used as an alternative in most of the tenses)

G1492.def: used only in certain past tenses, the others being borrowed from the equivalent G3700 (ὀπτάνομαι) and G3708 (ὁράω); properly, to see (literally or figuratively); by implication, (in the perfect tense only) to know

G1510.derivation: the first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb

G2064.def: to come or go (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
G2064.derivation: middle voice of a primary verb (used only in the present and imperfect tenses, the others being supplied by a kindred (middle voice) ἐλεύθομαι, or (active) ἔλθω, which do not otherwise occur)

G2192.def: to hold (used in very various applications, literally or figuratively, direct or remote; such as possession; ability, contiuity, relation, or condition)
G2192.derivation: including an alternate form σχέω; (used in certain tenses only) a primary verb

G2250.def: day, i.e. (literally) the time space between dawn and dark, or the whole 24 hours (but several days were usually reckoned by the Jews as inclusive of the parts of both extremes); figuratively, a period (always defined more or less clearly by the context)
G2250.derivation: feminine (with G5610 (ὥρα) implied) of a derivative of ἧμαι (to sit; akin to the base of G1476 (ἑδραῖος)) meaning tame, i.e. gentle

G2400.def: second person singular imperative middle voice of G1492 (εἴδω); used as an interjection to denote surprise; lo!
G2400.derivation: second person singular imperative middle voice of G1492 (εἴδω)

G3004.def: properly, to 'lay' forth, i.e. (figuratively) relate (in words (usually of systematic or set discourse; whereas G2036 (ἔπω) and G5346 (φημί) generally refer to an individual expression or speech respectively; while G4483 (ῥέω) is properly to break silence merely, and G2980 (λαλέω) means an extended or random harangue)); by implication, to mean

G3778.def: the he (she or it), i.e. this or that (often with article repeated)
G3778.derivation: including nominative masculine plural οὗτοι, nominative feminine singular αὕτη, and nominative feminine plural αὗται

G4771.derivation: the person pronoun of the second person singular

G5120.def: of the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom)
G5120.derivation: properly, the genitive case of G3588 (ὁ)
